newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: Slovak Jan PPI +6.1 pct yr/yr (+4.9 pct Dec).
newsitem.headline: Slovak Jan PPI +6.1 pct yr/yr (+4.9 pct Dec).

text.p: Slovak producer prices (PPI) rose 6.1 percent year-on-year in January 1997, after rising 4.9 percent in December 1996, the Slovak Statistical Bureau (SUSR) said on Tuesday.
SUSR did not provide comparison figures for January 1996, saying it has begun calculating PPI according to European Union standards.
Prices of coke, oil products and nuclear fuels were the fastest rising components of PPI, up 24.5 percent year-on-year, compared with a 23.7 increase in December 1996, SUSR said.
SUSR added that industrial producer prices were up 6.5 percent year-on-year, compared with a 5.2 percent year-on-year increase last month.
Prices of electricity, gas and water rose 4.6 percent, up from a December increase of 4.1 percent.
SUSR said in a statement that the adjustment to EU standards for PPI included a revision of the structure of the index, increasing the number of items to 2,966 from a previous 1,820.
The price base for the calculation is December 1995, and the bureau collects information from around 480 respondents.
The weight of the items in the index was derived from the structure of industrial producers income. The statement did not elaborate further.
Earlier this month, SUSR reported that Slovak consumer price index rose 1.1 percent month-on-month in January, putting the prices 5.8 percent higher than in the same month last year.
